problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What is the formula for electric power when given voltage \(V\) and current \(I\)?
problems.hint: Power = how much energy per second, using voltage and current.
problems.detailed: Electric power \(P\) is given by \(P = V \times I\), where \(V\) is voltage in volts and \(I\) is current in amperes.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: A lamp draws \(0.5\,\text{A}\) when connected to a battery of \(12\,\text{V}\). What power does the lamp consume?

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which unit is used to measure electric power?
problems.hint: Look for the unit that corresponds to energy per second.
problems.detailed: Electric power is measured in watts (W), which is equivalent to joules per second (J/s).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: If a resistor of \(10\,\Omega\) has a voltage of \(20\,\text{V}\) across it, what is the power removed (dissipated) by it?
problems.hint: Either use \(P = V^2 / R\) or first find current with \(I = V/R\).
problems.detailed: First, \(I = V/R = 20 / 10 = 2\,\text{A}\). Then \(P = V I = 20 \times 2 = 40\,\text{W}\). Alternatively, \(P = V^2 / R = (20)^2 / 10 = 400/10 = 40\,\text{W}\).
